alert.note: Alert for Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 5:29PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Gusty outflow winds from weak showers or sprinkles will impact portions of northeastern Douglas and northwestern Elbert Counties through 615 PM MDT... At 527 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking gusty outflow winds, along a line extending from 13 miles south of Bennett to 10 miles northeast of Ponderosa Park to 5 miles east of Parker. Movement was south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree branches and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Eastern Parker, Elizabeth, Kiowa, Ponderosa Park and The Pinery. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County
